newsitem.title: JAPAN: Mori Denki to tie up with HK's Far East Group.
newsitem.headline: Mori Denki to tie up with HK's Far East Group.

text.p: Mori Denki Manufacturing Co Ltd said on Tuesday it had agreed with Hong Kong's Far East Group, centred on Far East Consortium International Ltd, on a broad business tie-up.
Mori also said in a statement that it would issue 8.9 million new shares in a third-party allocation to Far East Organization Finance (International) Ltd, a member firm of the Far East Group, in May.
Mori, a manufacturer of industrial lighting equipment and electrical engineering materials, said the new shares would be issued at 225 yen per share.
After the share issue, Far East Organization Finance will become Mori's largest share holder, with a stake of about 24.8 percent.
Mori, suffering from a slump in its domestic business, said it hoped to invest jointly with the Far East Group in shopping centres in Asia and to manage other real estate projects in the region.
Funds to be raised through the new share issue will be invested in Beijing shopping centres owned and managed by the Far East Group, Mori said.
The company added that the impact of the tie-up on its earnings was not yet known and it would announce an earnings forecast as soon as possible.
